intro: Matricaria conoclinia, commonly known as German chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, aromatic leaves. Its flowers bloom in the summer months and are used in herbal remedies for their calming and anti-inflammatory properties. Matricaria conoclinia is often cultivated for its essential oils and medicinal applications.
